2024 Question: In which language are you submitting your response?
Select the currency used for all financial information disclosed throughout your response.
Notes for changes: The question has been integrated to avoid duplication of reporting.

2024 Question: Provide an overview and introduction to your organization.
Notes for changes: Additional columns so organizations can indicate the organization type. For example, publicly traded or privately owned.

2024 Question: State the end date of the year for which you are reporting data. For emissions data, indicate whether you will be providing emissions data for past reporting years.
Notes for changes: 'Start date' column removed to reduce reporting burden.

2024 Question: Provide details on your reporting boundary.
Notes for changes: Organizations can indicate whether they are reporting for the same group as they report financial statements, aligned with environmental reporting standards recommendations. If not, they provide details of why not.

2024 Question: Does your organization have an ISIN code or another unique identifier (e.g., Ticker, CUSIP, etc.)?
Notes for changes: Only minor changes with the addition/adjustment of dropdown options to improve data quality and ensure clarity of datapoints.

2024 Question: Select the countries/areas in which you operate.
Notes for changes: Guidance has been updated to clarify that ‘operate’ refers to the countries/areas where the entities in the organization’s reporting boundary are based and/or conduct business.

2024 Question: Are you able to provide geolocation data for your facilities?
Please provide all available geolocation data for your facilities.
What was the size of your organization based on total assets value at the end of the reporting period?
Notes for changes: New question was added to allow financial institutions to report the value of the total assets.

2024 Question: Which activities does your organization undertake, and which industry sectors does your organization lend to, invest in, and/or insure?
Notes for changes: Financial institutions can report on the size of the portfolio and the type of clients which they work with for the portfolio.

2024 Question: Are greenhouse gas emissions and/or water-related impacts from the production, processing/manufacturing, distribution activities or the consumption of your products relevant to your current CDP disclosure?
2023 Climate change question number: C-AC0.6/C-FB0.6/C-PF0.6, C-AC0.6a-g/C-FB0.6a-g/C-PF0.6a-g, C-AC0.6a/C-FB0.6a/C-PF0.6a, C-AC0.6b/C-FB0.6b/C-PF0.6b, C-AC0.6c/C-FB0.6c/C-PF0.6c, C-AC0.6d/C-FB0.6d/C-PF0.6d, C-AC0.6e/C-FB0.6e/C-PF0.6e, C-AC0.6g/C-FB0.6g/C-PF0.6g
Notes for changes: Questions from climate change and water questionnaires merged to reduce the reporting burden. The question was updated to clarify data requests and improve data quality.

2024 Question: Which part of the concrete value chain does your organization operate in?
In which part of the coal value chain does your organization operate?
Notes for changes: Minor changes to wording of data points to improve clarity of data requested.

2024 Question: In which part of the chemicals value chain does your organization operate?
Notes for changes: Minor changes to wording of data points to improve clarity of data requested.

2024 Question: Which real estate and/or construction activities does your organization engage in?
In which part of the electric utilities value chain does your organization operate?
Notes for changes: Minor changes to wording of data points to improve clarity of data requested.

2024 Question: For your electricity generation activities, provide details of your nameplate capacity and electricity generation specifics for each technology employed.
Notes for changes: Column "Own or control operations which use this power generation source" added to streamline reporting and allow for easier analysis.

2024 Question: In which part of the metals and mining value chain does your organization operate?
Notes for changes: Minor changes to wording of data points to improve clarity of data requested.

2024 Question: Provide details on the mining projects covered by this disclosure, by specifying your project(s) type, location and mining method(s) used.
Forests change: This quesiton is now shown to Biodiversity disclosers instead of Forests disclosers
Notes for changes: Question remains unchanged but will now be shown to organizations disclosing for biodiversity rather than forests.

2024 Question: In which part of the oil and gas value chain does your organization operate?
Notes for changes: Minor changes to wording of data points to improve clarity of data requested.

2024 Question: Which parts of the steel value chain does your organization operate in?
For which transport modes will you be providing data?
Provide details on the commodities that you produce and/or source.
Notes for changes: Updated to combine three questions into one to streamline questions. New datapoints added on volumes and reasons for not disclosing as part of approach to the single forests score.

2024 Question: Which of the following agricultural commodities that your organization produces and/or sources are the most significant to your business by revenue?
Notes for changes: The question has been integrated and the structure has changed from a “Select from/add row” to a “Fixed row” with a commodity per row.

2024 Question: Has your organization mapped its value chain?
Notes for changes: Previously only shown to forests disclosers, integrated to collect information from all disclosers on their approaches to value chain mapping. Alignment with ESRS.

2024 Question: Have you mapped where in your direct operations or elsewhere in your value chain plastics are produced, commercialized, used, and/or disposed of?
Notes for changes: Allows financial institutions and organizations to map where plastics supports revenue creation. End-of-life management was added as a value chain stage to cover the entire value chain. A new column was added to ask for which end-of-life management pathways are available to report which determines what is shown in 10.6.

2024 Question: Which commodities has your organization mapped in your upstream value chain (i.e., supply chain)?
Notes for changes: Updated to allow disclosers to report % of suppliers mapped per tier and improve data quality.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
2024 Question: How does your organization define short-, medium-, and long-term time horizons in relation to the identification, assessment, and management of your environmental dependencies, impacts, risks, and opportunities?
Notes for changes: Integrated to request the time horizons used in assessment of dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunity in line with standards (notably IFRS S2/TNFD).

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Does your organization have a process for identifying, assessing, and managing environmental dependencies and/or impacts?
Notes for changes: Allows organizations to report whether they assess their environmental dependencies and impacts, in alignment with TNFD.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Does your organization have a process for identifying, assessing, and managing environmental risks and/or opportunities?
Notes for changes: Updated to allow organizations to report whether they assess their environmental risks and opportunities, and whether this is informed by their dependencies and impacts process, in alignment with TNFD.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Provide details of your organization’s process for identifying, assessing, and managing environmental dependencies, impacts, risks, and/or opportunities.
Notes for changes: Updated to allow organizations to report a single process for multiple environmental issues. Allows organizations to report dependencies and impacts in alignment with TNFD. Additional columns have been added to allow for easier analysis.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Provide mining-specific details of your organization’s process for identifying, assessing, and managing biodiversity impacts.
Notes for changes: Methods and tools' column removed to avoid repetition with 2.2.2.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Does your organization have a process for identifying, assessing, and managing environmental dependencies and/or impacts related to your portfolio activities?
Notes for changes: Question added to allow for Financial institutions to report on environmental dependencies and/or impacts related to their portfolio activities, in alignment with TNFD.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Does your organization have a process for identifying, assessing, and managing environmental risks and/or opportunities related to your portfolio activities?
Notes for changes: Financial institutions can report on environmental risks and/or opportunities related to their portfolio activities, in alignment with TNFD.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Provide details of your organization’s process for identifying, assessing, and managing environmental dependencies, impacts, risks, and/or opportunities related to your portfolio activities.
Notes for changes: Updated to allow for financial institutions to report a single process for environmental dependencies, impacts, risks, and/or opportunities covering multiple environmental issues for each portfolio. Additional columns have been added to allow for easier analysis.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Are the interconnections between environmental dependencies, impacts, risks and/or opportunities assessed?
Notes for changes: Question added to align with TNFD.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Does your organization consider environmental information about your clients/investees as part of your due diligence and/or environmental dependencies, impacts, risks and/or opportunities assessment process?
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
Section: Process for identifying, assessing, and managing dependencies, impacts, risks and opportunities
2024 Question: Indicate the environmental information your organization considers about clients/investees as part of your due diligence and/or environmental dependencies, impacts, risks and/or opportunities assessment process, and how this influences decision-making.
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration. Organizations are requested to report the '% of portfolio covered by the process in relation to total portfolio value'. Open text field has been removed.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
2024 Question: Have you identified priority locations across your value chain?
Notes for changes: Question added to align with TNFD.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
2024 Question: How does your organization define substantive effects on your organization?
Notes for changes: Improved for data quality and to clarify the link to risks and opportunities disclosure.

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
2024 Question: Does your organization identify and classify potential water pollutants associated with its activities that could have a detrimental impact on water ecosystems or human health?

Module name: Identification, Assessment and Management of Dependencies, Impacts, Risks, and Opportunities
2024 Question: Describe how your organization minimizes the adverse impacts of potential water pollutants on water ecosystems or human health associated with your activities.

Notes for changes: Question dependency has been revised. Question now depends on selecting “Surface coal mining” or “Underground coal mining” in column “Aspect” of 1.13, and on 1.17 for selecting “Mining”. Definition for tailings dams added.

2024 Question: Do you evaluate and classify the tailings dams under your control according to the consequences of their failure to human health and ecosystems?

2024 Question: Provide details for all dams classified as 'hazardous' or 'highly hazardous'.

Section: Tailings dams management procedures W-MM/CO only
2024 Question: To manage the potential impacts to human health or water ecosystems associated with the tailings dams in your control, what procedures are in place for all of your dams?

Have you identified any environmental risks which have had a substantive effect on your organization in the reporting year, or are anticipated to have a substantive effect on your organization in the future?
Notes for changes: The main change allows organizations to report on multiple environmental issues. Value chain options from the 2023 Water questionnaire are now shown to all disclosers in column 1.

2024 Question: Provide details of the environmental risks identified which have had a substantive effect on your organization in the reporting year, or are anticipated to have a substantive effect on your organization in the future.
Notes for changes: Organizations requested to report risks with substantive effects in the reporting year and risks anticipated to have substantive effects in the future. Integration led to more details about the risk requested (e.g. country area). Qualitative information on effects, and if possible quantitative, is asked per time horizon.

2024 Question: Provide the amount and proportion of your financial metrics from the reporting year that are vulnerable to the substantive effects of environmental risks.
Notes for changes: New question added in alignment with IFRS S2/TNFD.

2024 Question: Within each river basin, how many facilities are exposed to substantive effects of water-related risks, and what percentage of your total number of facilities does this represent?
Notes for changes: The datapoint on the “Number of facilities exposed to water-related risk per river basin” has been split out to request a number of facilities for each value chain stage within the same river basin. The datapoint on the “% of total facilities exposed to water-related risk in this river basin” is now only asked for direct operations.

2024 Question: In the reporting year, was your organization subject to any fines, enforcement orders, and/or other penalties for water-related regulatory violations?
Provide the total number and financial value of all water-related fines.
Provide details for all significant fines, enforcement orders and/or other penalties for water-related regulatory violations in the reporting year, and your plans for resolving them.
In the reporting year, was your organization subject to any fines, enforcement orders, and/or other penalties for violation of biodiversity-related regulation?
Forests change: This quesiton is now shown to Biodiversity disclosers instead of Forests disclosers

2024 Question: Provide details for all significant fines, enforcement orders and/or other penalties for biodiversity-related regulatory violations in the reporting year, and your plans for resolving them.
Forests change: This quesiton is now shown to Biodiversity disclosers instead of Forests disclosers

2024 Question: Are any of your operations or activities regulated by a carbon pricing system (i.e. ETS, Cap & Trade or Carbon Tax)?
Select the carbon pricing regulations which impact your operations.
Notes for changes: Update list of carbon pricing regulations to align with carbon pricing dashboard.

2024 Question: Provide details of each Emissions Trading Scheme (ETS) your organization is regulated by.
Notes for changes: Update list of carbon pricing regulations to align with carbon pricing dashboard.

2024 Question: Complete the following table for each of the tax systems you are regulated by.
Notes for changes: Update list of carbon pricing regulations to align with carbon pricing dashboard.

2024 Question: What is your strategy for complying with the systems you are regulated by or anticipate being regulated by?

Have you identified any environmental opportunities which have had a substantive effect on your organization in the reporting year, or are anticipated to have a substantive effect on your organization in the future?
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

2024 Question: Provide details of the environmental opportunities identified which have had a substantive effect on your organization in the reporting year, or are anticipated to have a substantive effect on your organization in the future.
Notes for changes: Organizations requested to report opportunities with substantive effects in the reporting year and opportunities anticipated to have substantive effects. Integration led to more details about the opportunity requested (e.g. country area). Qualitative information on effects, and if possible quantitative, is asked per time horizon.

2024 Question: Provide the amount and proportion of your financial metrics in the reporting year that are aligned with the substantive effects of environmental opportunities.
Notes for changes: Driven directly by IFRS S2/TNFD alignment.

2024 Question: Does your organization have a board of directors or an equivalent governing body?
Notes for changes: To indicate whether there is a board or equivalent, and if yes, they will be requested on frequency of meeting and composition of the board.

2024 Question: Is there board-level oversight of environmental issues within your organization?
Notes for changes: Integrated, and allows organizations to report the details if they do not have oversight.

2024 Question: Identify the positions (do not include any names) of the individuals or committees on the board with accountability for environmental issues and provide details of the board’s oversight of environmental issues.
Notes for changes: Details on oversight for each environmental issue is now requested in one question. Dropdown options updated for IFRS S2 and TNFS alignment. New datapoint on policies outlining accountability aligned with IFRS S2.

2024 Question: Does your organization’s board have competency on environmental issues?
Notes for changes: Requests competency of board as a whole rather than individuals on board, aligning with IFRS S2 and ESRS. Improved request for competence and on mechanisms to maintain competence.

2024 Question: Is there management-level responsibility for environmental issues within your organization?
Notes for changes: Structure of the question has changed to allow organizations to report on multiple environmental issues in one question and to report details if there is no management-level responsibility.

2024 Question: Provide the highest senior management-level positions or committees with responsibility for environmental issues (do not include the names of individuals).
Notes for changes: Focus on highest-level senior management position to align with requests from IFRS S2/ESRS and minimize reporting burden. Dropdown options added and aligned with other governance questions.

2024 Question: Does your organization have management-level competency on environmental issues?
Notes for changes: Provides an alternative on competency to 4.2 for organizations without a board.

2024 Question: Do you provide monetary incentives for the management of environmental issues, including the attainment of targets?
Notes for changes: Allows organizations to report on multiple environmental issues. A new column on % total executive incentives added to align with IFRS S2. Only monetary incentives requested. New column on % total executive incentives added to align with IFRS S2. Only monetary incentives requested.

2024 Question: Provide further details on the monetary incentives provided for the management of environmental issues (do not include the names of individuals).
Notes for changes: Only details on monetary incentives for senior management and above are requested to align with standards and reduce reporting burden. The column on incentive plan (or equiv.) that the incentive is part of, taken from climate change, is now asked for all environmental issues with updated dropdown options and guidance.

2024 Question: Does your organization have an environmental policy that addresses environmental issues?
Notes for changes: The question has been integrated and aligns with ESRS and AFi.

2024 Question: Provide details of your environmental policies.
Notes for changes: Allows organisations to respond holistically on their environmental policies in an integrated question. New column to understand whether the policies are in line with global environmental treaties or policy goals. Alignment with ESRS and AFi.

2024 Question: Does the policy framework for the portfolio activities of your organization include environmental requirements that clients/investees need to meet, and/or exclusion policies?
Notes for changes: Rephrased question text to apply to all environmental issues.

2024 Question: Provide details of the policies which include environmental requirements that clients/investees need to meet.
Notes for changes: Rephrased question text to apply to all environmental issues and introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

2024 Question: Provide details of your exclusion policies related to industries, activities and/or locations exposed or contributing to environmental risks.
Notes for changes: Rephrased question text to apply to all environmental issues.

2024 Question: Does your organization include covenants in financing agreements to reflect and enforce your environmental policies?
Notes for changes: Rephrased question text to apply to all environmental issues.

2024 Question: Provide details of the covenants included in your organization’s financing agreements to reflect and enforce your environmental policies.
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration. Additional columns added for analysis.

2024 Question: Does your organization offer its employees a pension scheme that incorporates environmental criteria in its holdings?
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

2024 Question: Are you a signatory or member of any environmental collaborative frameworks or initiatives?
In the reporting year, did your organization engage in activities that could directly or indirectly influence policy, law, or regulation that may (positively or negatively) impact the environment?
Notes for changes:
New datapoint on transparency registers driven by ESRS alignment.

Asks whether engagement is aligned with global environmental treaties or goals beyond the Paris Agreement to facilitate the inclusion of new environmental issues.

2024 Question: On what policies, laws, or regulations that may (positively or negatively) impact the environment has your organization been engaging directly with policy makers in the reporting year?
Notes for changes:
New request for funding of policy makers in line with ESRS.

Types of direct engagement column which was previously a text field is now drop-down options.

Asks whether engagement is aligned with global environmental treaties or goals beyond the Paris Agreement to facilitate the inclusion of new environmental issues.

2024 Question: Provide details of your indirect engagement on policy, law, or regulation that may (positively or negatively) impact the environment through trade associations or other intermediary organizations or individuals in the reporting year.
Notes for changes:
Combination of 2023's C12.3b and C12.3c under one question on "Indirect engagement". This is to streamline the questions.

Asks whether engagement is aligned with global environmental treaties or goals beyond the Paris Agreement to facilitate the inclusion of new environmental issues.

2024 Question: Have you published information about your organization’s response to environmental issues for this reporting year in places other than your CDP response?
Notes for changes: Yes/no datapoint split into separate question to improve data quality.

2024 Question: Provide details on the information published about your organization’s response to environmental issues for this reporting year in places other than your CDP response. Please attach the publication.
Notes for changes:
Datapoints added to facilitate integration.

New datapoint capture the standard or framework the reporting being disclosed on is aligned with (e.g., IFRS, TNFD).

2024 Question: Does your organization use scenario analysis to identify environmental outcomes?
Notes for changes: This question has been integrated to allow reporting on multiple environmental issues, and now asks for the frequency assessment.

2024 Question: Provide details of the scenarios used in your organization’s scenario analysis.
Notes for changes: This question now allows the reporting of quantitative and/or qualitative approaches per environmental issue. Disclosers can now report their assumptions, constraints, and uncertainties, as well as the reference year, timeframes used, and risk types considered in line with TNFD risk types.

2024 Question: Provide details of the outcomes of your organization’s scenario analysis.
Notes for changes: Additional columns added for the business processes influenced by the analysis and the coverage of the analysis. Open text field remains that allows organizations to summarize the outcomes.

2024 Question: Does your organization’s strategy include a climate transition plan?
Notes for changes: In alignment with IFRS S2, this question now requests progress against the transition plan and key assumptions of the plan. The question also now includes details on policies for the exclusion of fossil fuel expansion, and increased clarity on the temperature alignment of the plan.

Section: Effect of Risks and Opportunities on Strategy and Financial Planning
2024 Question: Have environmental risks and opportunities affected your strategy and/or financial planning?
Notes for changes: Question has been added to understand if 5.3.1 and 5.3.2 should appear for an organization.

Section: Effect of Risks and Opportunities on Strategy and Financial Planning
2024 Question: Describe where and how environmental risks and opportunities have affected your strategy.
Notes for changes: Strategy and financial planning are now split into two questions and this question focuses on strategy. Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration. An organization reports separately per business area, based on the selection in 5.3.

Section: Effect of Risks and Opportunities on Strategy and Financial Planning
2024 Question: Describe where and how environmental risks and opportunities have affected your financial planning.
Notes for changes: Strategy and financial planning are now split into two questions and this question focuses on financial planning. Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration. An organization can report multiple financial planning elements in one row.

2024 Question: In your organization’s financial accounting, do you identify spending/revenue that is aligned with your organization’s climate transition?
Notes for changes: Column on "Methodology or framework used to assess alignment with your organization's transition plan" added to drive a better nexus between transition planning and sustainable finance taxonomy reporting.

2024 Question: Quantify the amount and percentage share of your spending/revenue that is aligned with your organization’s climate transition.
Notes for changes: New column on "Methodology or framework used to assess alignment" added. New columns on % share of financial metrics that are taxonomy eligible and non-eligible per climate change objective added.

2024 Question: Quantify the percentage share of your spending/revenue that was associated with eligible and aligned activities under the sustainable finance taxonomy in the reporting year.
Notes for changes: 12 new activities added to the "Economic activities" column. New columns on % share of financial metrics that are taxonomy-eligible but whose alignment is not assessed added. Columns restructured for better flow.

2024 Question: Provide any additional contextual and/or verification/assurance information relevant to your organization’s taxonomy alignment.
Notes for changes: New columns added on details of minimum safeguards analysis, additional contextual information of taxonomy alignment and assurance/ verification of taxonomy data to improve the quality and specificity of data reported.

2024 Question: Does your organization invest in research and development (R&D) of low-carbon products or services related to your sector activities?
Sector: CE, CG, CH, CN, CO, EU, MM, OG, RE, ST, TO, TO-EPM, TS

2024 Question: Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for cement production activities over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for capital goods products and services over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for chemical production activities over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for metals and mining production activities over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for steel production activities over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for real estate and construction activities over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization's investments in low-carbon R&D for your sector activities over the last three years.
Provide details of your organization’s investments in low-carbon R&D for transport-related activities over the last three years.
Break down, by fossil fuel expansion activity, your organization’s CAPEX in the reporting year and CAPEX planned over the next 5 years.
Break down, by source, your organization’s CAPEX in the reporting year and CAPEX planned over the next 5 years.
Break down your total planned CAPEX in your current CAPEX plan for products and services (e.g. smart grids, digitalization, etc.).
Disclose the breakeven price (US$/BOE) required for cash neutrality during the reporting year, i.e. where cash flow from operations covers CAPEX and dividends paid/share buybacks.
What is the trend in your organization’s water-related capital expenditure (CAPEX) and operating expenditure (OPEX) for the reporting year, and the anticipated trend for the next reporting year?
Does your organization use an internal price on environmental externalities?
Notes for changes: The question for internal carbon pricing and internal water pricing have been integrated under ‘Pricing environmental externalities’. While the focus remains on internal carbon and water pricing, organizations can now disclose on any other internal price on environmental externalities. For example, internal plastic pricing.

2024 Question: Provide details of your organization’s internal price on carbon.
Notes for changes: This question now also requests; the price-setting methodology, details on price differentiation, % of emissions in the reporting year covered by the price, and monitoring and evaluation of pricing.

2024 Question: Provide details of your organization’s internal price on water.
Notes for changes: Updated to align with the internal carbon pricing question. Column ‘Factors beyond current market price are considered in the price’ added. If an organization does not consider any other factors, they will not be presented with any further columns as this is not considered an internal water price or management tool as it is set by a third party.

2024 Question: Do you engage with your value chain on environmental issues?
Notes for changes: This question now includes the "no route" aspect that was previously addressed as a separate question. The list of value chain stakeholders has been expanded.

2024 Question: Does your organization assess and classify suppliers according to their dependencies and/or impacts on the environment?
Notes for changes: Organizations report the criteria for assessing supplier dependencies and/or impacts on the environment, the number of tier 1 suppliers assessed, how they classify suppliers as having substantive dependencies and/or impacts on the environment and the % of suppliers meeting the threshold.

2024 Question: Does your organization prioritize which suppliers to engage with on environmental issues?
Notes for changes: New question introduced to drive prioritization of supplier engagement on environmental issues and ensure that engagement achieves the greatest benefits.

2024 Question: Provide details of your environmental engagement strategy with your clients.
Notes for changes: Several new columns to facilitate integration and alignment with IFRS S2.

2024 Question: Provide details of your environmental engagement strategy with your investees.
Notes for changes: Several new columns to facilitate integration and alignment with IFRS S2.

2024 Question: Do your suppliers have to meet environmental requirements as part of your organization’s purchasing process?
Notes for changes: Question now presented to disclosers for all environmental issues. Column on non-compliance policy added to incentivize (the introduction of) formal procedures for addressing supplier non-compliance.

2024 Question: Provide details of the environmental requirements that suppliers have to meet as part of your organization’s purchasing process, and the compliance measures in place.
Notes for changes: Columns on engagement of non-compliant suppliers have been added to incentivize the approach of retaining non-compliant suppliers while fostering compliance through active engagement. Supplier tier specified in columns' headings to improve data quality and allow for easier analysis.

2024 Question: Provide further details of your organization’s supplier engagement on environmental issues.
Notes for changes: Columns have been added to ensure data quality and allow for easier analysis.

2024 Question: Provide details of any environmental smallholder engagement activity.
Notes for changes: Column "Are you working with stakeholders?" removed as this datapoint is addressed in question 5.11.

2024 Question: Provide details of any environmental engagement activity with other stakeholders in the value chain.
Notes for changes: Minor improvements in existing datapoints to enhance data quality.

2024 Question: Indicate any mutually beneficial environmental initiatives you could collaborate on with specific CDP Supply Chain members.
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

2024 Question: Has your organization already implemented any mutually beneficial environmental initiatives due to CDP Supply Chain member engagement?
Notes for changes: This question now applies to all environmental issues.

2024 Question: Specify the CDP supply chain members that have prompted your implementation of mutually beneficial environmental initiatives and provide information on the initiatives.
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

2024 Question: Do your external asset managers have to meet environmental requirements as part of your organization’s selection process and engagement?
Notes for changes: This question now applies to all environmental issues.

2024 Question: Provide details of the environmental requirements that external asset managers have to meet as part of your organization's selection process and engagement .
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration.

2024 Question: Does your organization exercise voting rights as a shareholder on environmental issues?
Notes for changes: Rephrased question text to apply to all environmental issues.

2024 Question: Provide details of your shareholder voting record on environmental issues.
Notes for changes: Introduced an environmental issue column facilitating integration. Additional columns added for analysis.

2024 Question: Provide details on your chosen consolidation approach for the calculation of environmental performance data.
Notes for changes: Allows organizations to report on multiple environmental issues. Choice of consolidation approach must be explained for alignment with IFRS S2.

2024 Question: Is this your first year of reporting emissions data to CDP?
Has your organization undergone any structural changes in the reporting year, or are any previous structural changes being accounted for in this disclosure of emissions data?
Has your emissions accounting methodology, boundary, and/or reporting year definition changed in the reporting year?
Have your organization’s base year emissions and past years’ emissions been recalculated as a result of any changes or errors reported in 7.1.1 and/or 7.1.2?
Select the name of the standard, protocol, or methodology you have used to collect activity data and calculate emissions.

Notes for changes: To align with IFRS S2, organizations are requested to report the reasons for changes to targets, the target objectives and if the target includes greenhouse gases. Additional guidance for maintenance targets has been added. For SBTi-approved targets, organizations will be requested to attach an official validation letter.

2024 Question: Provide details of your emissions intensity targets and progress made against those targets.
Notes for changes: To align with IFRS S2, organizations are requested to report the reasons for changes to targets, the target objectives and if the target includes greenhouse gases. Additional guidance for maintenance targets has been added. For SBTi-approved targets, organizations will be requested to attach an official validation letter.

2024 Question: Explain why you did not have an emissions target, and forecast how your emissions will change over the next five years.

Notes for changes: Improved disclosure for portfolio targets by addition of new columns and addition of new metrics.

2024 Question: Did you have any other climate-related targets that were active in the reporting year?
Notes for changes: To improve clarity for reporting maintenance targets.

2024 Question: Provide details of your targets to increase or maintain low-carbon energy consumption or production.
Notes for changes: To align with IFRS S2, organizations are requested to report the reasons for changes to targets and the target objective. Additional guidance for maintenance targets has been added. For SBTi-approved targets, organizations are requested to attach their official validation letter.

2024 Question: Provide details of any other climate-related targets, including methane reduction targets.
Notes for changes: To align with IFRS S2, organizations are requested to report the reasons for changes to targets and the target objective. Additional target types have been added, and additional guidance for reporting for maintenance targets For SBTi-approved targets, the organization's official validation letter is requested.

2024 Question: Provide details of your net-zero targets.
Notes for changes: To align with IFRS S2, organizations are requested to report the year the target was set, GHGs covered by the target, the target status in the reporting year, and reasons for change to the target. To align with SBTi, organizations are requested to disclose their beyond value chain mitigation (BVCM) activities. Additional guidance has been added on the use of credits and BVCM.

Section: Metrics for the production of plastic polymers
2024 Question: Provide the total weight of plastic polymers sold and indicate the raw material content.
Notes for changes: Language changed from 'pre-industrial recycled content' to 'post-consumer recycled content' to align with EMF Global Commitment. This language is more commonly used and more widely accepted.

Section: Metrics for durable goods and durable components
2024 Question: Provide the total weight of plastic durable goods and durable components produced, sold and/or used and indicate the raw material content.
Notes for changes: Updated to expand the scope to cover more plastics-related activities and the entire value chain. Partially aligns with ESRS E5: Circular Economy and Resource Use and WWF ReSource Tracker.

2024 Question: Provide the total weight of plastic packaging sold and/or used and indicate the raw material content.
Notes for changes: Language changed from 'pre-industrial recycled content' to 'post-consumer recycled content' to align with EMF Global Commitment. This language is more commonly used and more widely accepted.

2024 Question: Indicate the circularity potential of the plastic packaging you sold and/or used.
Provide the total weight of waste generated by the plastic you produce, commercialize, use and/or process and indicate the end-of-life management pathways.
Notes for changes: Allows full coverage of the value chain by asking for disclosure on the end-of-life management stage. Aligns with ESRS E5: Circular Economy and Resource Use, GRI 306: Waste and WWF ReSource Tracker.
